content.paragraph: A Post in an Online Group is an email to the group. Online Groups use email as a group collaboration medium. All posts go to all participants and to the Messages area. Posts can't be deleted.
To make a post, either address a new email to the Online Group's email address (shown on the Online Group's home page), or reply to a post you have received via the Online Group.
You can also make posts directly from this website. In the Messages area of your Online Group, use the "start a conversation" and "add to conversation" links.

You can read posts in an Online Group using your email client (Outlook, GroupWise…) or in the Group's Messages area on this website. The Messages area organises the posts into Conversations. You may be able to configure your email software to display conversations (or "threads") as well.
Use the Files area to share files. Put the file in the Files area and email the group to say it is there.
You can email another group member directly any time you like. Just click on their email address in an email or on this site. The jargon for this it to "back-channel".

bulletlist.listitem: all posts you make go to everyone in the group — make sure you aware of who is in the group and who can join or see into the group (described in the Membership and Roles section of the Online Group's Home page)
use the Files area to share files (you can't send file attachments in Online Groups)
Online Groups work best when people participate and even better when you participate effectively
